text: Cosipara cyclophora is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Harrison Gray Dyar Jr. in 1918. It is found in Zacualpan, Mexico. The wingspan is about 17 mm. The forewings are purplish grey, irrorated with black. There is a discal mark in the form of a black ring in a red-brown cloud. The hindwings are dirty white, but darker on the edge. Adults have been recorded on wing in May.Proceedings of the United States National Museum 54 (2239): 370 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1918 Category:Scopariinae
title: Cosipara cyclophora
